title: Laptop penetration in the United Kingdom ( UK ) 2009 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Percentage of population, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2013 to 2009.
Also, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2019 to 2017.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2017 to 2016.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2016 to 2015.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2015 to 2014.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2014 to 2013.
gold: Laptop computing has come a long way in the past decade , with increased power , battery life , portability and display quality all enhancing the attractiveness of a portable computer over a desktop computer . The penetration rate of the laptop in the United Kingdom reflects this , increasing from 47 percent in 2009 , to 60 percent in 2019 . Laptops penetration highest among 35 - 54 year olds Laptop penetration rates are above 50 percent across each of the main age groups , and highest among those aged 35 - 54 years .
